Bio

I am a graduate student at MIT pursuing a Master’s in Computational Science and Engineering. My research focuses on developing machine learning models for healthcare, and I'm interested in applications ranging from protein function prediction and drug discovery to personalized health devices. I have worked on integrating biological insights into ML models, leading to improved accuracy and impactful advancements in precision medicine.

Previously, I graduated as the top student in Chemical Engineering and Data Science at IIT Madras, where I worked on domain-informed ML models for chemical systems and fairness-aware decision systems. I am passionate about creating inclusive, explainable models to tackle complex challenges at the intersection of computation, biology, and engineering.

Outside of research, I mentor high school students in applying ML to healthcare through MIT Lincoln Labs' Medlytics program and volunteer in initiatives aimed at increasing diversity in STEM.
